args:
With the gates to the Realm of the Dead opened,
the prince and his friends must fight through the
undead and find a mana fount in order to save
Alberia. Though the long slog wears at morale,
Shingen's bold words rouse them to continue.
Listen well: Those mad fools of the\nMukuroshu have thrown open the gates\nto the Realm of the Dead.
You mean the world brimming with deadly\nmiasma? THAT Realm of the Dead?!
The same. Rifts linking to the realm have\nalready begun appearing across Hinomoto.
Left alone, the chi of this world will merge\nwith the Yomi chi, and Hinomoto will be\noverrun by walking corpses.
Nay, not Hinomoto alone. The chaos shall\nspread to all the world through the dragon-\nveins that connect it...
So how do we stop it?
First, we brace for the Mukuroshu's attack\nby stationing Wyrmclan leaders all across\nHinomoto.
Send word to the Tiger Wyrmclan leader\nwho is out delivering blessings: He should\naid our Alberian allies, then hurry home.
...I see. In that case, I march for Alberia.
I erected a temporary barrier upon the\ncastle gates, Lord Shingen.
Good. That should ensure the dead\nwon't take this place for a while.
If I may, what exactly are those beings we\nsee outside? Some sort of mimic wrought\nfrom the chi of the underworld?
They are false and true both—the lingering\nchi of Alberia's heroes mingled with the\nYomi chi, giving rise to new flesh.

Though they hold the memories of those
they resemble, inside they are something
entirely other...manifestations of Yomi
that bring death to the living.
Then my father's soul is being manipulated\nby Yomi chi?
This is a violation of Myriam's very soul.\nWe must put a stop to it at once.
The Eight-span Mirror I hold can sever the\nYomi chi that flows here through the\ndragon-vein spring.
Dragon-vein spring? Ah, you mean what\nwe call mana founts.
If we have our destination, let's get\nmoving. We'll use the tunnels to avoid\nthat pack of undead outside.
Ugh... It's nothing but living dead\nas far as the eye can see.
I have never seen so many at once.\nHow can we possibly do this...?
Hold up, Izumo. Are you scared?
Of course not! This is not fear, merely...\ner...a worry we may not achieve our goal.
And that's different from being afraid...\nhow, exactly?

Yuki, Izumo is a noble fellow who serves
Hinomoto at court, not at war. It is only
natural for him to feel most ill at ease
in this predicament.
Right! Gotcha. In that case, stay behind\nme, little fella. I'll keep you safe!
Yes, I will do just that.

If they surround us, we're finished,
so move quick and leave none alive!
...Er, or not alive. Undead. Un-undead?
Look, you know what I mean.
How many of these things are there?!
All right, let's get this over wi—HEY!
Whoa! More of them showed up!\nNow the way's blocked again!
Perhaps it would be wise to retreat for\nthe moment and—
Lady Yukimura?! What are you doing?!
Clearing a damn path! Follow me!
What?! But I can't just charge through\na sea of the undead!
Maybe slow down for a hot second and\nthink about how fast the people BEHIND\nyou can run, ya big idiot!
This lot has no backbone at all.
I'm so sorry, General! I told him to stay\nbehind me, but then I sorta...ran off.
Young warriors are ever overzealous, so a\ngeneral must adjust for it. Just try to give\na thought to caution in the future.
The fault is mine, Lord Shingen;\nmy legs were shaking too hard to run.\nForgive me.
Nope! It's all my fault. I'm really, really,\nREALLY sorry.
Enough. There is no fault to be claimed\nhere. Now ready your weapons, because\nmore of them are coming!
The Yomi chi grows thicker. If a wave this\nsize were to appear all at once...
*pant* *heave* It's too much! We'll never\nget past unless we stop the flow of chi!
Isn't that the whole reason we're TRYING\nto get past?! If we can't get through,\nthen—
Ack, I'm out of arrows!\nI can't fight anymore!
Argh! It's too cramped in here to change to\ndragon form! What am I supposed to do?!
They're getting disheartened...\nBut I know just the thing!
Well, now. The king will serve\nas vanguard?
Naturally! I'll become the tip of the spear\nso that others can follow with confidence.
This is the duty of a royal.
Ha ha ha! Admirable resolve, sir!

You speak it true: Be it vassal or subject,
any who would stand above another must
be ready to stand before them. Only then
do others have cause to rally behind you.
It seems New Alberia has a fine ruler,\nwhich means I must do my part.
HEAR ME WELL, ALL OF YOU!
Cast fear from your hearts and take\nstrength from your monarch—one who\nfights for his people and their peace!
Well, I suppose things aren't THAT bad...\nI do have my darling, after all!
Even if I can't change to my dragon form,\nI've still got the strength of a girl in love!
Just so. Every one of you holds tremendous\nstrength—a strength that can shield the\npeople and their homes! YOUR homes!
He's right. If we don't keep fighting now,\nwe'll lose everything we've tried to protect!
It seems I must grit my teeth and push\nonward a bit longer.
You'll not be fighting alone. If you've the\nheart to take weapon in hand once more,\nI will fight at your side to the death.

Numbers are but a hollow distraction!
The essence of a warrior is to stand
undaunted, each one of us a match for
legions of the enemy!
Now, brave souls! With me! WITH ME!
Sorry to keep you, darling! Just needed\na moment to catch my breath.
Just don't think I'm going to let you hog\nall the glory! We'll do this together!
Amazing... A few words from Shingen\nand everyone's morale is restored?
Pah. I merely bade them take a good look\nat the prince who stands before them.
The might of Hinomoto's general is clear\nnow, which means I definitely need to\ncarry my own weight. Now let's go!
